courseDescription:
In this free online course, you will grasp the fundamental elements of the language of music. Anyone who wants to enter the fascinating world of music can master valuable skills and techniques with the easy-to-follow videos. Music students who want to understand the fundamentals of music theory better will benefit greatly, too. You will analyse in-depth three main subjects, namely note theory, main theory and harmony elements. See how you can begin playing a keyboard fluently by applying the methods learnt from this course. You will also learn the root knowledge of a piano, often referred to as the king of musical instruments.

Begin by studying how the letters in music, referred to as notes, are circles written on the five lines of the music stave, and are represented by the first seven letters of the alphabet (A B C D E F G). Music is a straightforward language that is based on simple logic. By applying the logic and skills you acquire, you will be able to see that music theory is much easier to grasp than often thought. You will then discover harmony elements and have the opportunity to put them into practice in order to hear how all the pieces work in music. The tutorial videos can be followed along on the piano keys, allowing you to learn piano-playing elements.

By completing this course, you will have stronger knowledge that will give you the confidence to learn faster and successfully play the piano better. This course is available to all ages and backgrounds. If you wanted to learn music at one point in your life but you did not, and the desire to master it is still there, then this course is for you. It is never too late to play music! Covered in this course are different musical notes, correct note placements on a musical stave, and much more. You will be able to follow along with the instructor on your own personal keyboard. All you need to do is create your free Alison account and enrol today.

modules.description: In this module, we will analyse the elements of music theory concerning musical notation. We will learn to read the notes on G and F clefs. We will also see these notes on the piano keyboard. We'll specify the meaning of the high and the bass notes, and also the different octaves in the staff and on the piano keys.
